Metadata.Title: If You Host Your Service in a Windows Service, Expose a Metadata Exchange (mex) Binding
Metadata.DirectLink: If You Host Your Service in a Windows Service, Expose a Metadata Exchange (mex) Binding
Metadata.Priority: J.D. Meier, Jason Taylor, Prashant Bansode, Carlos Farre, Madhu Sundararajan, Rob Boucher, Steve Gregersen

Content.Data:
Applies to

  • Microsoft® Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) 3.5
  • Microsoft Visual Studio® 2008

What to Do

If you host your service in a Windows Service, expose a Metadata Exchange (mex) Binding.

How

If you are hosting your service as a Windows service and are exposing the service using the netTcpBinding, publish the service metadata by creating a mexTcpBinding endpoint so that your clients can discover and use the service. Clients will be able to generate a proxy file using the ServiceModel Metadata Utility Tool (Svcutil.exe).

Additional Resources

  • For more information on publishing metadata endpoints, see “Publishing Metadata” at http://msdn2.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa751951.aspx
  • For configuration management Q&A, see the Configuration Management section of “WCF 3.5 Questions and Answers “ at http://www.codeplex.com/WCFSecurityGuide/Wiki/View.aspx?title=WCF%20Questions%20and%20Answers%20%28Q%26A%29&referringTitle=Home
